introduction.welcome_message:
Welcome to the WIM Wedding Planning Demo

This scenario demonstrates how WIM manages the beautiful chaos of
luxury wedding coordination, where vendor crises and emotional clients
require constant context switching without losing critical details.

scenario.name: Final Preparations Disrupted by Florist Cancellation
scenario.description: Finalizing seating chart when florist's owner is hospitalized, requiring immediate replacement 23 days before $145K wedding

events.content: SCENE 1: Anderson-Chen Wedding - Final Details

Wedding: Anderson-Chen
Date: December 28, 2024 (23 days away)
Venue: Rosewood Estate Vineyards
Guests: 220 (218 confirmed)
Budget: $145,000

‚ñ∂ Creating primary intent in WIM...

Intent: "Execute Anderson-Chen wedding flawlessly"

tasks.description: Confirm final headcount with caterer and venue
Finalize seating chart and escort card calligraphy
Final walkthrough with photographer and videographer
Coordinate day-of timeline with all 14 vendors
Final dress fitting and emergency kit prep

events.content:
Task Progress:
  ‚úì WED-FINAL-01: Confirm final headcount
  ‚Üí WED-FINAL-02: Finalize seating chart [IN PROGRESS - 75%]
  ‚Ä¢ WED-FINAL-03: Final venue walkthrough
  ‚Ä¢ WED-FINAL-04: Coordinate day-of timeline (14 vendors)
  ‚Ä¢ WED-FINAL-05: Final dress fitting

current_task.issue: Table 8 - Aunt Margaret vs Uncle Tom (divorce drama)
current_task.solution: Move Uncle Tom to Table 12 with college friends

events.content: SCENE 2: üíê VENDOR CRISIS ALERT üíê

events.title: FLORIST EMERGENCY
events.content:
Bella Flora (florist) just CANCELED
Owner hospitalized - business temporarily closed
Time to find replacement: 48 hours

Floral Arrangements Affected:
  ‚Ä¢ Bridal bouquet (white peonies, garden roses, eucalyptus)
  ‚Ä¢ 6 bridesmaid bouquets
  ‚Ä¢ 12 boutonnieres
  ‚Ä¢ Ceremony arch (3ft √ó 8ft floral installation)
  ‚Ä¢ 14 reception centerpieces (tall and low alternating)
  ‚Ä¢ Cake table, gift table, restroom arrangements
  ‚Ä¢ Contract value: $8,500

events.rationale: Quality florists book fast - 48-hour window critical

events.content:
WIM Interruption Handler analyzing...

  Current intent urgency: 0.75 (Seating chart - important)
  Interruption urgency:   0.88 (Florist crisis - time-sensitive)
  Interruption threshold: 0.80

‚Üí Vendor crisis EXCEEDS threshold by 0.08
‚Üí Decision: HANDLE IMMEDIATELY - Quality vendors book fast

Bride's stress level: 3/10 ‚Üí 8/10 (CRISIS MODE)
SCENE 3: Context Preservation - Wedding Details

WIM is preserving wedding coordination context...

‚ñ∂ Capturing seating chart state:

  ‚úì Spreadsheet: anderson_chen_seating_v8.xlsx
  ‚úì Tables 1-7, 9-15 finalized (14/15)
  ‚úì Table 8 issue: Aunt Margaret vs Uncle Tom
  ‚úì Solution proposed: Move Tom to Table 12
  ‚úì Pending: Bride's approval via text

‚ñ∂ Florist research already started:
  ‚Ä¢ Backup option 1: Garden of Eden ($9,200 - +$700)
  ‚Ä¢ Backup option 2: Petal & Stem ($8,800 - +$300)
  ‚Ä¢ Backup option 3: Moonlight Florals (unavailable - booked)
SCENE 4: Florist Crisis Resolution

Rapid-fire vendor search in progress...

Evaluating replacement florists:

Garden of Eden Florals:
  ‚Ä¢ Available: ‚úì
  ‚Ä¢ Quote: $9,200 (+$700 over original)
  ‚Ä¢ Style match: 85% - different rose variety needed
  ‚Ä¢ Can replicate design: Yes, with substitutions

Petal & Stem:
  ‚Ä¢ Available: ‚úì
  ‚Ä¢ Quote: $8,800 (+$300 over original)
  ‚Ä¢ Style match: 92% - exact match possible
  ‚Ä¢ Can replicate design: Yes, exact colors and flowers
  ‚Ä¢ Portfolio: Stunning, bride will love this

‚Üí WIM Decision: Petal & Stem
    Best style match, reasonable price increase, available immediately

Actions completed:
  ‚úì Called Petal & Stem (2:47 PM)
  ‚úì Sent bride's Pinterest inspo board
  ‚úì Received mock-ups (3:15 PM)
  ‚úì Bride approved via video call (3:42 PM)
  ‚úì Contract signed (4:18 PM)
  ‚úì Deposit paid ($3,500)

Crisis resolved in 4 hours

Bride's stress level: 8/10 ‚Üí 3/10 (RELIEVED!)

"Thank you SO much! I was panicking but you fixed it so fast!"
- Rebecca (bride)
SCENE 5: Returning to Seating Chart
6:45 PM - Crisis resolved, resuming normal work

‚ñ∂ WIM restoring seating chart context:

  ‚úì Reopened: anderson_chen_seating_v8.xlsx
  ‚úì Highlighted: Table 8 (the problem table)
  ‚úì Restored note: 'Move Uncle Tom to Table 12 - awaiting approval'
  ‚úì Bride's text arrived: 'Yes! Move Tom. Perfect solution!'

‚ñ∂ Completing seating chart:
  ‚úì Uncle Tom moved to Table 12
  ‚úì Added college friend group to Table 12
  ‚úì Aunt Margaret stays at Table 8 with bride's family
  ‚úì Final chart complete (15/15 tables)
  ‚úì Sent to venue coordinator
  ‚úì Ordered escort cards (calligraphy deadline met)

‚ñ∂ Context restoration time: 1 minute

Without WIM: 15-20 minutes to remember where you were
With WIM: 1 minute - perfect continuity
SCENE 6: End-of-Day Report
WIM VALUE PROPOSITION: Wedding Planning

without_wim: Critical details forgotten during crisis (guest allergies, preferences)
Client stress escalates without quick responses
Average 18 hours to manage vendor crisis
with_wim: Zero details lost (guest needs, vendor specs, family dynamics)
Client stress reduced by 63% through confidence
Vendor history and preferences automatically recalled
key_benefits: Family dynamics preserved (who can't sit with whom)
Pinterest boards and inspiration linked to tasks

value_proposition.why_wim_matters: Every detail matters on a bride's special day. Vendor crises are inevitable, but losing track of details is not. WIM ensures nothing falls through the cracks.
